result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry L Rigby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Ct. 3

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Ct. 3

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with Child Support and Paternity Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.

Plea hearing on May 17, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on April 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
ATTY Ager files motion to modify bond.

Cts 1-3: 961.41(1)(cm)1g-Manuf/Del Cocaine; Ct 4961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place; Cts 5 & 6: 946.41(1)-Resist/Obst. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 03-15-2016:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest  through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions for taking mother to medical treatment or services, attorney visits, and court. If defendant does post bond, he is to be tested by ZCI on a weekly basis.   Do not drive unless properly licensed.

Defendant Jerry L Rigby in court with attorney Timothy James Ager.  Defendant Jerry L Rigby in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking that bond be modified to $2,500.00 cash along with co-signed portion with sister. The State objects to any modification of bond indicating deft was highly uncooperative with officers and refused to come out of where he was hiding. Ashley Green 2/8/89.

BTC: Bond modification is granted to $5000.00 cash. GPS monitoring/house arrest. May only leave to take mother to medical treatment or services, attorney visits, and court and if deft can post the cash, must be tested by ZCI on a weekly basis. May only drive if deft has valid drivers license
To mod bond
